item.title: Dynacons Systems & Solutions Secures ₹74.99 Crore Device-as-a-Service Project from Jammu Kashmir Bank
item.description: Top News Dynacons Systems & Solutions Secures ₹74.99 Crore Device-as-a-Service Project from Jammu Kashmir Bank 8 minutes ago Dynacons Systems & Solutions Limited has won a prestigious ₹74.99 crore Device-as-a-Service project from Jammu Kashmir Bank, formally disclosed through regulatory filing under SEBI Regulation 30. The five-year comprehensive digital workplace solution involves deploying 9,851 advanced desktops across 1,019 branches nationwide on an Opex-based model, covering the entire device lifecycle from procurement to e-waste management.

item.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank Limited Schedules Investor Meeting at Citi India Financials Tour 2025
item.description: Kotak Mahindra Bank Limited Schedules Investor Meeting at Citi India Financials Tour 2025 1 hour ago Kotak Mahindra Bank Limited has scheduled an investor meeting for December 16, 2025, at the Citi India Financials Tour 2025 in Mumbai. The bank notified stock exchanges about this engagement with analysts and institutional investors as required under SEBI Regulation 30. The disclosure ensures transparency in investor relations activities and compliance with listing obligations.

item.title: iStreet Network Limited Board Approves Share Consolidation from ₹4 to ₹10 Face Value
item.description: iStreet Network Limited Board Approves Share Consolidation from ₹4 to ₹10 Face Value 2 hours ago iStreet Network Limited's Board of Directors approved a share consolidation plan on December 11, 2025, converting equity shares from ₹4.00 to ₹10.00 face value at a 5:2 ratio. The consolidation aims to align with industry standards, enhance capital structure stability, and improve institutional readiness. Subject to regulatory and shareholder approvals, the process is expected to complete within 3 months while maintaining the same authorized capital of ₹80.00 crores.

item.title: Vidya Wires Limited Lists at ₹52.13 on BSE, Trades Above Issue Price
item.description: Vidya Wires Limited Lists at ₹52.13 on BSE, Trades Above Issue Price 1 day ago Vidya Wires Limited debuted on BSE at ₹52.13 per share, trading above its IPO issue price of ₹52.00. The listing reflects a modest premium of ₹0.13, representing approximately 0.25% gains over the offer price. The successful market debut enables regular trading of the company's shares on the exchange.
